Package com.example.sjsuwebsite.controller

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
com.example.sjsuwebsite.controller.MainController
@Controller
public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object
Controller Displays .jsp files depending on the type of URL the base URL that is required to start the project: localhost:8008 Then it will run any method based on the URL including the base URL

  • Method Details

    • MainPage

      @RequestMapping("/MainPage") public java.lang.String MainPage​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User goes to specified URL
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attribute to the URL so the .jsp file can get those data from the Controller
      Returns:
      What it returns is the name of the .jsp file that will be displayed for the URL /MainPage

    • ItemPage

      @RequestMapping("/ItemPage") public java.lang.String ItemPage​(@RequestParam(name="ItemNumber") int ItemNumber, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User goes to specified URL
      Parameters:
      ItemNumber - The ItemNumber will be grabbed from the URL and it will display the Item based on the ItemNumber.
      model - The Item that was received from the ItemNumber will then will be stored to the Model
      Returns:
      What it returns is the name of the .jsp file that will be displayed for the URL /ItemPage

    • ItemPage2

      @PostMapping("/ItemPage") public java.lang.String ItemPage2​(@RequestParam(name="Stock") int Stock, @RequestParam(name="ItemNumber") int ItemNumber, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User enters/submits data
      Parameters:
      Stock - The Stock is needed to put the number of stock to the CartList, if the Stock number is 0, It will Post an error to the .jsp file
      ItemNumber - The ItemNumber is needed to get which item from the ItemList that it needs to be copied and set the number of Stock
      model - The Model is needed to put attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      Then it will redirect to the MainPage

    • Cart

      @RequestMapping("/Cart") public java.lang.String Cart​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User goes to specified URL
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to set attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      The method returns the page named cart.jsp with the URL /Cart

    • updateCart

      @PostMapping(value="/Cart", params={"quantity","itemNumber","Submit"}) public java.lang.String updateCart​(org.springframework.ui.Model model, @RequestParam int quantity, @RequestParam int itemNumber)
      This is called when User enters data
      Parameters:
      model - Model is used to add attributes to the URL
      quantity - The quantity is needed to change the quantity from the CartList. If the quantity is below 0, It will shoot an error to the .jsp file instead
      itemNumber - The itemNumber is needed to get which item in the cart that needs modifying
      Returns:
      Both quantity less than equal to -1 and above -1 will return cart.jsp file with the URL /Cart

    • deleteCart

      @PostMapping(value="/Cart", params={"quantity","itemNumber","Delete"}) public java.lang.String deleteCart​(org.springframework.ui.Model model, @RequestParam java.lang.String itemNumber)
      This is called when User enters data
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      itemNumber - ItemNumber is needed to know which part of the ArrayList is needed to be deleted
      Returns:
      returns cart.jsp file and the URL will be /Cart

    • checkoutCart

      @PostMapping(value="/Cart", params="Checkout") public java.lang.String checkoutCart​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User enters data
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      If any of the CartList has a quantity of 0, then it will shoot an error and return cart.jsp with the URL /Cart If not, The CartList will add up all the quantity and the cost and put those data to the History class, along with the date that it was created and currentUsers' name Then it will reduce the amount of stock based on the CartList and subtract the corresponding items on ItemList Then It will clear the cart and redirect to the ConfirmCheckout

    • ConfirmCheckout

      @RequestMapping("/ConfirmCheckout") public java.lang.String ConfirmCheckout​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User goes to the specified URL
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      It will return ConfirmCheckout.jsp with the URL /ConfirmCheckout

    • Logout

      @PostMapping(value="/ConfirmCheckout", params="Logout") public java.lang.String Logout​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User enters data
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      Removes data from currentUser by making it as a new User Redirects to Login

    • ContinueShopping

      @PostMapping(value="/ConfirmCheckout", params="Continue") public java.lang.String ContinueShopping​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User enters data
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to Model
      Returns:
      Redirects to MainPage

    • Login

      @RequestMapping("/Login") public java.lang.String Login​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User goes to the specified URL
      Parameters:
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      return Login.jsp with the URL /Login

    • getLog

      @PostMapping("/Login") public java.lang.String getLog​(@ModelAttribute Users user, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when User enters data
      Parameters:
      user - A set of params is grabbed from the URL to form a class User
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      First it checks if the User exist in the database If the user does exist, It redirects to the MainPage If not the it will send a message to the .jsp and returns Login.jsp and sets the URL /Login

    • getPurchaseHistory

      @RequestMapping("/PurchaseHistory") public java.lang.String getPurchaseHistory​(@ModelAttribute History userHistory, org.springframework.ui.Model model) throws java.io.IOException
      This is called when the user wants to see their purchase history
      Parameters:
      userHistory - Gets the History model so we can use it in the purchase history functionality
      model - Used to add attributes to the function
      Returns:
      Returns purchase history
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • changePassword

      @PostMapping("/ChangePassword") public java.lang.String changePassword​(@ModelAttribute Users user, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function is called when the user wants to change their password
      Parameters:
      user - Grabs the user model to use in the function
      model - Model is used to add attributes to the webpage
      Returns:
      If successful, the user changes their password and is redirected to the login page to use their new password If unsuccessful, the user is redirected back to their settings page alerting them that their change password request was unsuccessful

    • getSubmit

      @PostMapping("/SignUp") public java.lang.String getSubmit​(@ModelAttribute Users user, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This is called when the User enters data
      Parameters:
      user - Grabs a set of params from the URL and turns that data to be part of User class
      model - Model is needed to add attributes to the URL
      Returns:
      First checks the database if the user exists in the database. If it does exist, then it send a Message to the .jsp file and returns SignUp.jsp with the URL /SignUP If not, adds the the user to the database then redirects to the Login
